title.narrative: Awareness Raising and Advocacy on HFCs Ratification of Kigali Amendment to the Montreal Protocol

description.narrative: Bangladesh Centre for Advanced Studies (BCAS) has already conducted an advocacy project with support from Christian Aid in Advocacy on SDGs implementation in HtR areas focussing LNB imperative . The project identified the high concentration of poverty, high level of food insecurity & malnutrition and education, health, WASH, energy and gender equity are prevailing in the lagging behind and climate affected ecosystems. As a technical partner of Christian Aid, BCAS proposes to undertake a awareness raising of CSOs and private sectors and advocacy with national actors including government and stakeholders on Hydrofluorocarbons (HFCs) ratification of Kigali Amendment to the Montreal Protocol. This is aiming to increase awareness and sensitize the government, the civil society groups, private sectors and conduct Advocacy with government and stakeholders through reviewing state of the ratification of HFCs phase out with update progress of the Kigali amendment to the Montreal Protocol in the national context. In this purpose the following tasks will be performed by BCAS with technical and financial supports of Christian Aid.

• Civil society groups and private sectors including air condition assemblers, importers and manufacturers of HFC and relevant stakeholders will be aware and sensitized about urgent need of phasing out HFCs through endorsing Kigali amendment. The workshop proceedings will be prepared based on the feedbacks and recommendations of the participants.
• Concerned and relevant stakeholders will be aware and sensitized about urgent need of phasing out HFCs through endorsing Kigali amendment.
• 1500 copies of policy brief will be published. Civil society groups, private sectors media groups, government departments, NGOs, INGOs and UN agencies as well as individuals including researchers and academicians will get insight and benefits from this policy brief. BCAS and Christian Aid will share the policy brief with relevant government department and ministries for further use and influencing policy decisions.
